com.cerner.beadledom.client

Class BeadledomClientBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.ws.rs.client.ClientBuilder
      • com.cerner.beadledom.client.BeadledomClientBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.ws.rs.core.Configurable<javax.ws.rs.client.ClientBuilder>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeadledomResteasyClientBuilder

    public abstract class BeadledomClientBuilder
extends javax.ws.rs.client.ClientBuilder
    An abstract builder for creating an instance of Client.

    The static methods will use SPI to look for an implementation of this builder on the classpath.

    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    John Leacox, Sundeep Paruvu

    • Method Detail

      • newBuilder

        public static BeadledomClientBuilder newBuilder()
        Return a new instance of BeadledomClientBuilder by looking for an implementation on the classpath using SPI.

        If the SPI finds more than one implementation of BeadledomClientBuilder in the classpath then it always creates the ClientBuilder for the implementation that comes first on classpath. So it is non-deterministic that which client implementation will be created at runtime.

        However, if a specific implementation is required then the consumer should use the implementation specific Factory class method #create to create the builder.

      • buildTarget

        public BeadledomWebTarget buildTarget(String baseUrl)
        Return a new instance of {@link BeadledomWebTarget} with the given String path by using the default builder implementation on the classpath found using SPI.

      • newClient

        public static javax.ws.rs.client.Client newClient()
        Return a new default instance of Client by using the default builder implementation on the classpath found using SPI.

      • newClient

        public static javax.ws.rs.client.Client newClient(javax.ws.rs.core.Configuration configuration)
        Return a new instance of Client with the given configuration by using the the builder implementation on the classpath found using SPI.

        If multiple builder implementations are found, the first will be used, which may be non-deterministic.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a builder implementation is not found
